course.subject: ECON
course.name: Urban and Environment Economics
course.description: The course is designed to introduce students to key contemporary concepts in urban and environmental economics, and to equip them with the approaches in economics that are generally applied to analyze urban/environmental problems and policies. The course will be divided into two parts. Part I will cover topics on the economics of cities, including rent and wage determination, the location decisions of households and firms, agglomeration economics, housing, transportation and land use. Part II will focus on environmental economics, covering topics on externalities, Pigouvian policies and environmental valuation.
course.prerequisites: ECON 2103 OR ECON 2113

reviews.author: Edwin1025
reviews.title: Very recommended!
reviews.comment_content: Not boring content. Basically, talk about the theory of city and environment which is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is friendly but merely interacts with the classes. She sometimes asked some questions in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 problem sets (85,100,100)
1 midterm
1 final exam
1 10 pages essay
participation

Get an A finally.
mid-term above mean, dunno about the final. Didn't put much effort into the essay and nearly didn't go to the lecture. It's very good grade maybe due to the small class size.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 problem sets
1 midterm
1 final exam
1 10 pages essay
content is not cumulative

reviews.author: Stellahhhh
reviews.title: Really nice grade
reviews.comment_content:
Though the pre-requirement of this course is only basic math courses and basic economics courses, the content will cover some Econometrics knowledge.

Introduction to Urban Economics
Microeconomics and econometrics review
Why do cities exist
Why do firms cluster
City sizes
Urban growth (and decline)
Urban land rent
Land use
Neighborhood choices
------------------
Intro to environmental economics
Externality, cap and trade
Environmental valuation
Housing
Transportation
Climate change and cities
reviews.comment_teaching:
a little bit fast but acceptable
She is nice and will have a small zoom chat with you if you need help in your individual project.
reviews.comment_grading:
Really good grade
Three problem sets: 15%; (85/100;100/100;100/100)
Individual project(10 pages essay): 15%; (no distribution provided)
Mid-term exam: 30%; (below mean a little bit)
Final exam: 35%; (no distribution provided)
Class Participation: 5% (no distribution provided)

Finally got A

reviews.author: nicknameee
reviews.title: Very good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy econ stuff
-----------------------------
Introduction to Urban Economics
Microeconomics and econometrics review
Why do cities exist
Why do firms cluster
City sizes
Urban growth
Urban land rent
Land use
Neighborhood choices
reviews.comment_teaching: Tbh her tone is sooo flat that it sounds a bit boring, so I skipped 95% of the lectures. She is nice and will provide suggestions on project.
reviews.comment_grading: Very very good grade. Just 3 problem sets, one individual project, midterm and final. Got only 84/100 in midterm, and eventually got A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
Just skip all the class as it is just a waste of time.
